meanings.definition: A decrease in the number of white blood cells in the blood.
meanings.sent1: Leukopenia can make it harder for the body to fight infections.
meanings.sent2: The doctor diagnosed the patient with leukopenia after a blood test.
meanings.sent3: When the white blood cells went on strike, it was leukopenia all over!
meanings.sent4: In the battle against illness, leukopenia is like having fewer soldiers on the front lines.
meanings.sent5: The image of leukopenia is like a dwindling army facing a relentless enemy.

meanings.definition: Abnormally low white blood cell count.
meanings.sent1: Leukopenia can lead to increased susceptibility to infections.
meanings.sent2: The patient's leukopenia required close monitoring by the medical team.
meanings.sent3: The party of white blood cells was so small, it was like a leukopenia gathering!
meanings.sent4: In a sea of red blood cells, leukopenia stands out like a lone white flag.
meanings.sent5: The concept of leukopenia is like a ghost town in the body's defense system.
